title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22 ยง 806.22 - Voluntary nondisciplinary resignations; reinstatement
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22 ยง 806.22 - Voluntary nondisciplinary resignations; reinstatement

State Regulations
(a) An attorney's application to resign from
practice pursuant to Uniform Rules for Attorney Disciplinary Matters (section
1240.22
[a]
of
this Title) shall be submitted to the court by original sworn affidavit in the
form of Appendix E to Uniform Rules for Attorney Disciplinary Matters (Part
1240 of this Title), with proof of service of a copy thereof upon the committee
and the Lawyer's Fund for Client Protection. (b) An application for reinstatement
following nondisciplinary resignation shall be submitted to the court by
original sworn affidavit in the form of Appendix F to Uniform Rules for

Attorney Disciplinary Matters (Part 1240 of this Title), with proof of service
of a copy thereof upon the committee. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22
ยง
806.22

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
